meanings.definition: A molecule that has the same molecular formula and sequence of bonded atoms as another molecule, but differs in the three-dimensional arrangement of atoms.
meanings.sent1: The diastereoisomer of the compound had a different shape despite having the same atoms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the diastereoisomer to understand how its structure affected its properties.
meanings.sent3: The diastereoisomer walked into a party and everyone noticed its unique twist.
meanings.sent4: The diastereoisomer of success involved rearranging the pieces in a new way.
meanings.sent5: In the puzzle of molecules, the diastereoisomer stood out like a colorful piece in a sea of gray.

meanings.definition: One of a pair of stereoisomers that are not mirror images of each other.
meanings.sent1: The diastereoisomer was distinct from its mirror image counterpart.
meanings.sent2: Chemists distinguished between enantiomers and diastereoisomers in their experiments.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, the diastereoisomer and its mirror image wore matching outfits.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two diastereoisomers was like siblings who looked similar but had different personalities.
meanings.sent5: The diastereoisomer and its mirror image danced around each other, never quite reflecting the same moves.
